Sentencas: The biogas needs to be reformed before electro-chemical conversion in the solid-oxide fuel cell, which can be promoted efficiently with wise thermal management and reforming conditions.
Titulo: Comparison and optimization of different fuel processing options for biogas-fed solid-oxide fuel cell plants

Sentencas: To ensure the system safety and catalysts durability, additional mineral- bearing water and carbon deposition should be avoided.
Titulo: Comparison and optimization of different fuel processing options for biogas-fed solid-oxide fuel cell plants

Sentencas: This paper conducted a detailed biogas-SOFC CHP system analysis considering four layouts, featuring hot and cold recirculation of the anode off-gas, partial oxidation and complete internal reforming.
Titulo: Comparison and optimization of different fuel processing options for biogas-fed solid-oxide fuel cell plants

Sentencas: The process optimization and sensitivity analysis are performed with the design variables including the recirculation ratio, and external reformer temperature.
Titulo: Comparison and optimization of different fuel processing options for biogas-fed solid-oxide fuel cell plants

Sentencas: The anode supported SOFC operates at 800 degrees C and 0.4 A/cm(2) current density.
Titulo: Comparison and optimization of different fuel processing options for biogas-fed solid-oxide fuel cell plants

Sentencas: The results show that pre-reforming with hot recirculation and cold recirculation schemes achieve the highest system efficiency between 56% and 63%.
Titulo: Comparison and optimization of different fuel processing options for biogas-fed solid-oxide fuel cell plants

Sentencas: The pre-reforming with hot recirculation scheme has a broader self-sufficient water range eliminating the carbon deposition risk at the recirculation ratio of 42-78% and reforming temperature of 400-650 degrees C.
Titulo: Comparison and optimization of different fuel processing options for biogas-fed solid-oxide fuel cell plants

Sentencas: The no pre-reforming with hot recirculation scheme achieves maximum system efficiency of 58% due to the fuel dilution.
Titulo: Comparison and optimization of different fuel processing options for biogas-fed solid-oxide fuel cell plants

Sentencas: Moreover, the partial oxidation with hot recirculation scheme maximum efficiency is limited to 58.9%, given that the partial oxidation reaction is less efficient than steam and dry reforming reactions.
Titulo: Comparison and optimization of different fuel processing options for biogas-fed solid-oxide fuel cell plants

Sentencas: The proposed system layout could demonstrate the feasibility of biogas-SOFC with different reforming options especially on small scale with high efficiency and optimal thermal integration opportunities.
Titulo: Comparison and optimization of different fuel processing options for biogas-fed solid-oxide fuel cell plants
